isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM OVERVIEW - DIAGNOSTIC SOFTWARE OPERATION - Service Procedure

svcsubproc.title: Key-On Engine Off Output State Test
svcsubproc.para: The Key-On Engine Off Output State Test checks the operation of the ECM controlled actuators.
The Key-On Engine Off Output State Test has two operation modes:

para.emph: Key-On Engine Off Output State Low Test

figure.caption: Key-On Engine Off Output State Low Test

svcsubproc.para: Select Key-On Engine Off Output State Low Test from the EST Diagnostics Drop-Down Menu.

In this mode the ECM will pull down the output voltage to their low state. The low state test will actuate the output components controlled by the ECM grounding the circuits. Outputs are Low will be displayed on the screen.

para.emph: Key-On Engine Off Output State High Test

figure.caption: Key-On Engine Off Output State High Test

svcsubproc.para: Select Key-On Engine Off Output State High Test from the EST Diagnostics Drop-Down Menu.
In this mode the ECM will pull up the output voltage to their high state. The high state test will actuate the output components controlled by the ECM energizing the circuits.

note.para: During both test modes, output circuits can be monitored with a Digital Volt Meter (DMM). The DMM measures high or low voltages when outputs are toggled. The actual voltage will vary in the circuit tested. The EST will not display voltage or circuit problems. A breakout tee or breakout box and a DMM are required to monitor circuits and actuators. Diagnostic Trouble Codes will not be set by the ECM.

svcsubproc.para: The following actuators and signals are toggled during the Key-On Engine Off Output State Test:
